isis.stitle: GENERAL INSTRUMENT ELECTRONIC PROGRAMMABLE SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER - TEST 3 - SENSOR CIRCUIT GROUND AND RESISTANCE CHECK (AT INSTRUMENT PANEL)

svcproc.title: TEST 3 - SENSOR CIRCUIT GROUND AND RESISTANCE CHECK (AT INSTRUMENT PANEL)

svcprocinfo.para: This test checks the sensor circuits for isolation from ground and the sensor resistance, from the instrument panel connector through the vehicle harness to the sensor.

svcsubproc.title: Speedometer Circuits And Sensor

item.para: Turn switch key to OFF position.
This test requires the use of an ohmmeter.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 10 and Figure 11 for speedometer sensor test.

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. GOOD VEHICLE GROUND A. VEHICLE HARNESS SPEEDOMETER CONNECTOR B. CIRCUIT 47A OR 47B OR 47C C. CIRCUIT 47A OR 11BC OR 47E

figure.caption: Speedometer Sensor And Circuit Resistance Check

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. OHMMETER SET ON RX1 SCALE A. VEHICLE HARNESS SPEEDOMETER CONNECTOR B. CIRCUIT 47A OR 47B OR 47C C. CIRCUIT 47A OR 11BC OR 47E

step1.para: Set the Ohmmeter to the HIGHEST scale. Connect one meter lead to good vehicle ground.

Test instrument panel wire harness speedometer connector terminals 47A and 11BC (96/9700) or 47A and 47B (93/9400) or 47C and 47E (3406B w/PEEC) each to ground. Resistance should be greater than 100,000 ohms at each terminal. If resistance IS NOT greater than 100,000 ohms go to TEST 5. If OK perform Step 3 of this test.

Switch Ohmmeter to the Rx1 scale. Test instrument panel wire harness speedometer connector circuit resistance between terminals 47A and 11BC (96/9700) or 47A and 47B (93/9400) or 47C and 47E (3406B w/PEEC). See
SENSOR RESISTANCE CHART) for value. If resistance IS NOT within range specified on chart, go to TEST 5. If OK go to TEST 4.

svcsubproc.title: Tachometer Circuits And Sensor

item.para: Turn switch key to OFF position.
This Test Requires The Use Of An Ohmmeter.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 12 and Figure 13 for this test.

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. GOOD VEHICLE GROUND A. VEHICLE HARNESS TACHOMETER CONNECTOR B. CIRCUIT L48B OR 48B C. CIRCUIT C48A OR 48A

figure.caption: Tachometer Sensor And Circuit Resistance Test

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. OHMMETER SET ON RX1 SCALE A. VEHICLE HARNESS TACHOMETER CONNECTOR B. CIRCUIT L48B OR 48B C. CIRCUIT C48A OR 48A

step1.para: Set the Ohmmeter to the HIGHEST scale. Connect one meter lead to good vehicle ground.

Test instrument panel wire harness tachometer connector terminals 48A and 48B (96/9700) or C48A and L48B (93/9400) each to ground. Resistance should be greater than 100,000 ohms at each terminal. If resistance IS NOT greater than 100,000 ohms go to TEST 5. If OK perform step 3 of this test.

Switch Ohmmeter to the Rx1 scale. Test instrument panel wire harness tachometer connector circuit resistance between terminals 48A and 48B (96/9700) or C48A and L48B (93/9400). See
SENSOR RESISTANCE CHART) for values. If resistance IS NOT within range specified in chart, go to TEST 5. If OK go to TEST 4.
